column1: Non-Seasonal Allergic Runny Nose
column2: jennifer_33, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is the first medicated nasal spray that I've tried. My "allergy" symptoms went away after the first use, but unfortunately it gives me THE WORST headache I've ever had. I can't even turn my neck, it's awful. It's also causing my period even though I've been on birth control pills for years and it's not my time. It's great that it works so well, but I can't take the headache pain. No amount of Advil will take the pain away.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: LilyTortie, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: Omnaris worked wonderfully for me. But unfortunately, I am not on this medication now. I had tried several other prescription nasal sprays and other types of medications for my seasonal and year-round allergies- none worked. I have sinus problems, nasal congestion, congestion and itching in my ears and eustachian tubes. I have had ear infections and severe sinus infections. A few years ago, my doctor prescribed Omnaris. All of these symptoms stopped after I started using it. I can't remember exactly, but I think I did have headaches for the first several days, but they subsided after that. I've had headaches from other drugs that were much worse. I can't remember any other side effects. But after several months, my insurance stopped covering it. My new insurance won't cover it either. I would pay for it myself, but it is really expensive. In the long run, my insurance could end up paying more for sinus cat scans, antibiotics, and allergy meds that don't work, etc. than they would have just paid for the Omnaris.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy

column9: Went for annual eye exam.  I was told that I had borderline glaucoma in left eye. I have never been told this, but noticed that it was a possible side effect of this medication. I don't know how common this is but I'll probably stop using it until my next eye check in August and see what happens.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: hypsylady, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have terrible seasonal allergies and I'd finally had enough of taking meds that 1) don't do much of anything or 2) put me to sleep. I finally went to see an allergist who recommended Omnaris. I was hesitant because standard nosesprays give me chronic nosebleeds. He gave me a 3 week sample and encouraged me to just try it. Best 3 weeks of my life! After two days I had completely stopped sneezing, my congestion was minimal and the constant sinus drainage had cecased. After a week of using the spray, it was like I didn't have allergies anymore. The only side-effect I experienced was an ear infection about 2 weeks after starting the spray. But that could have been my inexperience using nosesprays because it cleared up quickly and I haven't had an issue since. It is a painfully expensive prescription but, when factored out, it costs about as much as I spend on pills throughout the summer and works a thousand times better than those pills ever have.

column1: Other
column2: Matt PSU, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This is the ONLY thing that has helped my non-allergic rhinitis induced sinus headaches.  I tried other sprays, but they caused a horrible sore throat.   I've used it for 3 years now and am somewhat dependent on it.  It makes my headaches go away and stays in the spot it's supposed to.Now, I find that the manufacturer (takeda- nycomed) is in some sort of blood fued with the marketing/distributor Sunovion, and they have stopped manufacturing!!! All we got was a letter saying they will not take new scripts or even back fill until they get their problems straightened out.  Supposedly there was a bad batch that got out in the field but that's only part of the story.  What am I supposed to do, go to Canada?  It is a disgrace that these two companies let this happen!
